00027         {

00029             Chart2.ImageStorageMode = ImageStorageMode.UseImageLocation;

00050         protected void Button1_Click(object sender, EventArgs e)
00051         {
00052             // Variable declarations
00053             StringBuilder dataURI = new StringBuilder();
00054             WebClient webClient = new WebClient();
00055             XmlDocument xmlChartConfig = new XmlDocument();
00056             XmlDocument xmlData = new XmlDocument();
00057             // Get the chart config
00058             Uri uri = new Uri(Server.MapPath("/Configuration/Charts/PriceHistory1.xml"),
00059               UriKind.RelativeOrAbsolute);
00060             Stream configData = webClient.OpenRead(uri);
00061             XmlTextReader xmlText = new XmlTextReader(configData);
00062             xmlChartConfig.Load(xmlText);
00063 
00064             // I'm hard coding to read in the chart called 'Price History 1'. In a
00065             // 'real' environment my config would contain multiple charts, and I'd
00066             // pass the desired chart (along with any parameters) in the request
00067             // string. But for simplicity I've kept this hard coded.
00068             XmlNodeList lst =
00069               xmlChartConfig.SelectNodes("/root/Chart[@Name='PriceHistory1']/Uri/*");
00070 
00071             // The first child contains the root URI
00072             dataURI.Append(lst.Item(0).InnerText.ToString());
00073 
00074             // If the textboxes are full use the values else use the config file
00075             if (!string.IsNullOrEmpty(ticker.Text) && startdate.SelectedDate != null && enddate.SelectedDate != null)
00076             {
00077                 dataURI.Append("?");
00078                 dataURI.Append(ticker.ID);
00079                 dataURI.Append("=");
00080                 dataURI.Append(ticker.Text);
00081                 dataURI.Append("&");
00082                 dataURI.Append(startdate.ID);
00083                 dataURI.Append("=");
00084                 dataURI.Append(string.Format("{0:MM-dd-yyyy}",startdate.SelectedDate));
00085                 dataURI.Append("&");
00086                 dataURI.Append(enddate.ID);
00087                 dataURI.Append("=");
00088                 dataURI.Append(string.Format("{0:MM-dd-yyyy}", enddate.SelectedDate));
00089             }
00090             else
00091             {
00092                 // The rest of the children of this node contain the parameters
00093                 // the first parameter is prefixed with ?, the rest with &
00094                 // i.e. http://url?firstparam=firstval&secondparam=secondval etc
00095                 for (int lp = 1; lp < lst.Count; lp++)
00096                 {
00097                     if (lp == 1)
00098                         dataURI.Append("?");
00099                     else
00100                         dataURI.Append("&");
00101 
00102                     // In this case the desired parameters are hard coded into the XML.
00103                     // in a 'real' server you'd likely accept them as params to this page
00104                     dataURI.Append(lst.Item(lp).Attributes.Item(0).Value.ToString());
00105                     dataURI.Append("=");
00106                     dataURI.Append(lst.Item(lp).InnerText);
00107                 }
00108             }
00109 
00110             // Now that we have the URI, we can call it and get the XML
00111             uri = new Uri(dataURI.ToString());
00112             Stream phData = webClient.OpenRead(uri);
00113             xmlText = new XmlTextReader(phData);
00114             xmlData.Load(xmlText);
00115 
00116             // This simple example is hard coded for a particular chart
00117             // ('PriceHistory1') and assumes only 1 series
00118             lst = xmlChartConfig.SelectNodes(
00119               "/root/Chart[@Name='PriceHistory1']/Data/SeriesDefinitions/Series/Data");
00120 
00121             // I'm taking the first series, because I only have 1
00122             // A 'real' server would iterate through all the matching nodes on the
00123             // XPath
00124             string xPath = lst.Item(0).InnerText;
00125 
00126             // I've read the XPath that determines the data location, so I can
00127             // create a nodelist from that
00128             XmlNodeList data = xmlData.SelectNodes(xPath);
00129             Series series = new Series();
00130 
00131             // I'm hard coding for 'Line' here -- the 'real' server should
00132             // read the chart type from the config
00133             series.ChartType = SeriesChartType.Line;
00134             double nCurrent = 0.0;
00135 
00136             // I can now iterate through all the values of the node list, and
00137             foreach (XmlNode nd in data)
00138             {
00139                 // .. create a DataPoint from them, which is added to the Series
00140                 DataPoint d = new DataPoint(nCurrent, Convert.ToDouble(nd.
00141                   InnerText));
00142                 series.Points.Add(d);
00143                 nCurrent++;
00144             }
00145 
00146             // Finally I add the series to my chart
00147             Chart2.Series.Add(series);
00148         }

00150         protected void Button2_Click(object sender, EventArgs e)
00151         {
00152             // Variable declarations
00153             WebClient webClient = new WebClient();
00154             XmlDocument xmlChartConfig = new XmlDocument();
00155             XmlDocument xmlData = new XmlDocument();
00156             // Get the chart config
00157             Uri uri = new Uri(Server.MapPath("/Configuration/Charts/PriceHistory1.xml"),
00158               UriKind.RelativeOrAbsolute);
00159             Stream configData = webClient.OpenRead(uri);
00160             XmlTextReader xmlText = new XmlTextReader(configData);
00161             xmlChartConfig.Load(xmlText);
00162             configData.Close();
00163 
00164             ChartConfigProvider chartConfig = new ChartConfigProvider(xmlChartConfig);
00165 
00166             ChartBuilder cb = new ChartBuilder(chartConfig, Chart2);
00167         }
